product_name: e.l.f. CosmeticsHalo Glow Contour Beauty Wand
summary: SummaryHighlightsCruelty FreeVeganContour like a pro! e.l.f. Cosmetics' Halo Glow Contour Beauty Wand lets you add natural definition and a luminous glow to your complexion. The lightweight, liquid formula is infused with hydrating squalane and effortlessly blends into skin while the wand's cushion-tip offers a precise application.
details: DetailsBenefitsEasy-to-use liquid contour wand with a cushion-tip applicatorGives you a radiant, naturally sculpted complexionLiquid, buildable contour formula effortlessly blends into skinInfused with skin-loving 2% squalane100% vegan, cruelty-free & Leaping Bunny CertifiedMade in a Fair-Trade Certified factoryFormulated WithoutPhthalatesParabensNonylphenol ethoxylatesTriclosanTriclocarbanHydroquinoneItem 2609181How To UseGently squeeze wand and use the cushion-tip applicator to apply to your hairline, temples, sides of your nose, hollows of your cheeks, and jawline, then blend in color with your fingertips or e.l.f. Putty Bronzer Brush for a naturally sculpted look.For a fully sculpted look, pair with the e.l.f. Halo Glow Blush Beauty Wand and Halo Glow Highlight Beauty Wand.IngredientsWater (Aqua), Hydrogenated Didecene, Isododecane, Glycerin, Propylene Glycol, Dimethicone, Cetyl PEG/PPG-10/1 Dimethicone, Trimethylsiloxysilicate, Squalane, Mica, Isoamyl Laurate, PEG 10 Dimethicone, Hydrogenated Styrene/Isoprene Copolymer, Sodium Chloride, Polyglyceryl-Isostearate, Disteardimonium Hectorite, Synthetic Sapphire, Caprylic/Capric Triglyceride, Propylene Carbonate, Tocopherol, Helianthus Annuus (Sunflower) Seed Oil, Calendula Officinalis Flower Extract, Polymethylsilsesquioxane, Hydrolyzed Sodium Hyaluronate, Sodium Hyaluronate, Disodium EDTA, Caprylyl Glycol, Phenoxyethanol, Ethylhexylglycerin, Triethoxycaprylylsilane, Aluminum Hydroxide, Pentaerythrityl Tetra-di-t-butyl Hydroxyhydrocinnamate. May Contain: Titanium Dioxide (CI 77891), Iron Oxides (CI 77491, CI 77492, CI 77499).
how_to_use: Gently squeeze wand and use the cushion-tip applicator to apply to your hairline, temples, sides of your nose, hollows of your cheeks, and jawline, then blend in color with your fingertips or e.l.f. Putty Bronzer Brush for a naturally sculpted look.For a fully sculpted look, pair with the e.l.f. Halo Glow Blush Beauty Wand and Halo Glow Highlight Beauty Wand.

reviews.headline: Colors are accurate to contour with
reviews.comments:
I like the color and that its non-comedogenic. It has been tough to find contour products that don't break me out. Finding true contour colors (neutral to cool. Slightly gray or dull) is also hard, no matter the price point. I don't love the sponge tip applicator, but it does work to apply a thin layer of the product. I also prefer the experience of cream contour sticks, but every single stick product I have tried, except a discontinued foundation from way back when, has broken me out. I've had the same problem with cream bronzers like the Nars Laguna Cream bronzers. Breakout city.

I had to struggle a bit to find a way to apply this to my face shape, but it's not because it's not easy to blend. The problem was my selection of brush and my placement. I'm using now the Rephr LC02 complexion brush which is very similar to the BK beauty 109 Mini Contoured Foundation: a small, dense, angled brush. I place my pointing finger under my cheekbone pointing at the top of my mouth, and then I stamp dots along the finger, using it as a guideline. I blend in patting motions over the dots, and then patting upwards a little, and at the ends, I sweep downwards over the bottom outer 1/2 of the face, to lower the contrast between the cheek contour and my foundation shade.

I will keep on repurchasing and would recommend. Its not a 5 stars product, but it does the job, the longevity is decent even in hot weather, its easy to use, and the color is right. Of utmost importance, its also non-comedogenic. I plan to buy the Kevin Acoin powder contour next month. Its the ONLY powder contour I've found that doesn't have the typical comedogenic red-dyes. It might still be a problem, but I'm crossing my fingers. If it fails, back to this one it is.

reviews.headline: Halo glow Bronzer
reviews.comments: It is such good quality and tbh, Elfs Halo glow collection is such good quality and looks great. This is such a good bronzer if you want your makeup or face in general to have a slight glow and for your features to look more defined, this especially makes my features look more defined and just better in general.

reviews.headline: Good contour and bronzer!
reviews.comments: I love this in shade medium/tan for a perfect bronzer shade and tan/deep is a great contour shade

reviews.headline: More bronzer but amazing
reviews.comments: I love this product. It is a gentle contour but not is not a bronzer either. It is a beautiful half way between the two. If you want a quick product that creates amazing shadow and warmth look no further. I reach for this product before many other products. I will be repurchasing! This product blends easily and has been a life saver.

reviews.headline: Throw this in the trash
reviews.comments: This product suprised me because i love elf but not this product it does not blend it has bad packaging it is not worth in

reviews.headline: This is awesome
reviews.comments: So I've not tried CT's version because I'm trying not to blow the bank on cosmetics. Threw this is in curbside order on a whim and absolutely love it! Can finally seem to contour my nose!

reviews.headline: It blends amazingly! I love the color!
reviews.comments: It blends beautifully and adds a nice subtle warmth.

reviews.headline: great product
reviews.comments: easy to blend, gorgeous amount of pigment!

reviews.headline: Want to love this product
reviews.comments:
This product is awesome on paper - affordable, blendable, versatile - but the packaging gets super messy and the applicator tip leaks product onto the cap, which feels like a waste. the applicator is nice but it sucks when you squeeze too much, there's no way get it back in the tube.
I also think this product breaks me out. I get really bad acne where it's applied. This could be related to the applicator, going directly on your skin over and over again. I'm going to clean and sanitize the tip and hopefully that decreases the acne.

reviews.headline: Absolutely love!
reviews.comments: It is such a cute contour and and it is easily blendable as well, I'm a girl who LOVES a dewy finish and this contour helps me with that!

reviews.headline: Great Cool Tone
reviews.comments: So happy there is a cool tone contour for a reasonable price. It goes on smoothly and stays. Will continue to purchase.

reviews.headline: no way
reviews.comments: I this is just a bad dupe of the Charlotte Tillbury one (I tried them both). I barely even squeezed it when a gush of product came right out of the bottle and landed right on my white shorts. I looked like I pooed myself. Would not recommend get Charlotte Tilburry instead.

reviews.headline: Great contour!
reviews.comments: Listen, I just started using contour in my late 30s and this is so easy to use! I'm a fair/cool tone and the lightest shade is perfection for me. It blends beautifully and looks great. My list for repurchasing makeup products is very short, but this has made it.

reviews.headline: Great contour!
reviews.comments: Listen, I just started using contour in my late 30s and this is so easy to use! I'm a fair/cool tone and the lightest shade is perfection for me. It blends beautifully and looks great. My list for repurchasing makeup products is very short, but this has made it.

reviews.headline: Great product
reviews.comments: I was tempted to get a prestige brand contour product but I use so little I liked that i thiught this would be easy to use. I dint normally buy this brand but it's exactly what i was looking for. I have light skin tone and the lightest color is great, cool tone as it should be. Small applicator applies easily and blends out evenly.

reviews.headline: Color is not the same
reviews.comments: I tried the fair/lightâ€¦too light. I tried the light/medium and its orangy. I like the LA Colors countour wand much better.

reviews.headline: fine product, TERRIBLE packaging
reviews.comments: the product wasnt terrible, it just didnt blend that great but the packaging was awful it would always spill it made me so angry i threw it away

reviews.headline: Perfect
reviews.comments: CONTOUR TO THE GODS

reviews.headline: Okay Product
reviews.comments: It works well - I have brown skin and I use the lighest shade because all the other ones look like warm bronzers instead of contour. The lightest shade gives a nice mix of bronzer/contour, however, it does somewhat blend into nothing so you do have to add a good amount of product.

faceoff_positive.comments:
I really like this. Haven't seen if it can survive summer heat so this might change. 

 I was hesitant to purchase this because I do have the putty bronzer in feelin' shady and I do not like that product because it completely blends away. The colors are similar, but not the same, this blends but I can actually still see this one after my face makeup is done and I put the translucent powder. It's hard to find a good cool contour this shade so far is my favorite. I think a few of these could be used on me as more of a bronzer on me so I might grab one when they restock for that. I had no problems with blending this into the blush, highlight, or the cream bronzer that I decided to use with this. It's not patchy at all. My only problem was the sponge and I rip that off.
